data.title: Trouble updating the app
data.description: I accidentally closed the app while it was updating and now it won't open
data.body:
I would recommend re-installing the app again, to be super safe:

1- Remove the app from the /Applications folder
2- Download and install the new version from here: https://inkstone.haiku.ai/v0/download/mac/latest

All your data should be safe, and you won't lose any of your projects by reinstalling.

data.title: Can't verify my email address
data.description: When creating an account, I can't verify my email, I get a 404.
data.body:
To start, please try clicking the "resend email" button. 

If you still have the same problem, then please to try in a new browser or incognito window.

If that doesn't work, please contact us.

data.title: Layer blurs from Figma in Animator
data.description: Does Animator support layer blurs from Figma? Can I export this effect to Lottie?
data.body:
Haiku Animator supports layer blurs (and they will work when rendered in web browsers using the Animator Core renderer) —but it seems that Lottie does not support this feature. 

References


[1] https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-web/issues/1540
[2] https://airbnb.io/lottie/#/supported-features
[3] https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-web/wiki/Effects

data.title: Troubleshooting: Forking projects
data.description: I'm having trouble when attempting to fork projects.
data.body:
First, try the following:

  • Ensure that you're logged into the same account in both your web browser and the desktop app

  • Try logging out and logging back in, both in your browser and in the desktop app

  • Ensure that Haiku Animator for Mac is installed in /Applications

  • Try forking using Chrome or Firefox instead of Safari or Edge

If the above don't help, it's likely that this issue is network-related.  Verify the following:

  • Are you on a corporate network that has a firewall or requires a proxy? If so, have you configured the proxy settings in the Haiku Animator desktop app?

  • Even if you tried with multiple public projects, to rule out the possibility of multiple projects misbehaving please verify if https://share.haiku.ai/u/Tina/S4TIllo/fork works for you.

  • Finally, are you able to create a new project from scratch and publish it from Haiku Animator?  Verifying this would help rule out of there's some other issue with installation or your workstation.

data.title: Installing packages when embedding an animation
data.description: Is it necessary to install a package for every animation I want to embed on my codebase?
data.body: For using Haiku Animator packages in a TypeScript codebase, we recommend adding a //@ts-ignore  on the line before the import statement where you import the Animator package.This will silence TypeScript errors that the imported package doesn't include typedefs while treating the imported object as any — arguably the best way to deal with any package that indeed doesn't include typedefs.

data.title: Download invoices
data.description: Where can I find my subscription's invoices?
data.body:
You can find and download all your invoices at https://account.haikuforteams.com/

From there, you can also manually add and edit your VAT information, including:

  • VAT Number

  • Company Name

  • Billing Address

This information will be present on all future invoices. It will not impact finalized invoices.

data.title: Changing colors in Lottie
data.description: How can I figure out which property is the fill one in the Lottie JS file?
data.body:
Lottie doesn't make this easy for you.  The file format is not intended for human editing / reading.

It's been a while since I cracked open the format to make sense of it — but I believe your colors are going to be in the format "k": [1,1,1,1]  (or from an example in your file: "k":[0.9058823529411765,0.8901960784313725,0.8745098039215686,1]) — IIRC that's RGBA, with four values 0-1 to represent 0=>100% for each channel.

You can also poke around the internet for solutions folks have found to this problem.

data.title: Deleting slices
data.description: How can I delete a Slice?
data.body:
To delete a slice, select it and simply hit the "delete" key on your keyboard! Just make sure your cursor is on the stage section of the app.

That's it!

data.title: Transparent backgrounds on the Stage
data.description: Can I apply a color background at first to, e.g., be able to see a white animation while I'm working, and then switch back to transparent?
data.body: You should be able to go back to frame 0, and enter #fff0 or its RGBA equivalent and get a transparent background once again.

data.title: controlFlow.repeat and controlFlow.if
data.description: I can't find documentation about controlFlow.repeat and controlFlow.if
data.body:
These features are experimental, officially unsupported, and thus undocumented.  If you want to explore, noting in advance that there are known bugs in this functionality:

  • repeat accepts an array, and you can refer to a given member of that array (i.e. within other expressions, e.g. to make the position a function of the data in the array) using $repeat.payload.

  • if accepts a boolean value, which will toggle whether the element is rendered on the stage.

data.title: Avoid using NPM when embedding on React
data.description: Is there a way to not use NPM when embedding on React, without exporting the file as GIF?
data.body: The source code for each Animator project lives inside ~/.haiku — the exact code that is published to npm is available there, so you can e.g. copy & paste it out if you prefer.

data.title: Animator is in Maintenance Mode
data.description: Is the app still in development? There haven't been any updates recently
data.body:
Animator is still live.  We continue operating the server infrastructure and supporting customers.  Billing continues, too, which helps keep our doors open. You should still be able to use the app, publish & share projects, fork, export Lottie, etc.  If you find it's suitable for your needs in its current state (e.g. most of our customers love it for creating + exporting Lottie animations & videos/GIFs) then you should be good to go. If you're encountering any issues with core functionality, please let us know.

"Maintenance mode" describes a freeze on new features & functionality, largely to keep the app stable for paying customers who have adopted Haiku into their motion-design-to-software workflows.

data.title: Transitions with boolean values
data.description: Can I use boolean values (true/false) on transitions?
data.body: We currently do not support transitions with boolean values (true/false). If you were to try it, your animation would jump from one state to the other with no transition.

data.title: Alternative to export high quality GIFs
data.description: When I export to GIF from Animator it looks pixelated/low quality
data.body: Something you can try to get crisp GIFs right now is, open your animation's link (which you can get from the Publish modal), zoom in on the browser if you'd like it to be bigger, and then use a tool like https://giphy.com/apps/giphycapture to record your screen and save as GIF.

data.title: Troubleshooting
data.description: What to do if I'm having problems with Animator
data.body:
Steps to troubleshoot

1. If you can’t get Animator to work, please:

  • Check if you have an active subscription at https://account.haikuforteams.com/

  • Make sure you're logged into Animator with the account used to purchase the subscription.

  • Quit Animator (cmd + Q) and re-open it

  • Reboot your computer

  • Download Animator again and re-install it.

  • Make sure you have Animator installed in the /Applications folder of your Mac computer. Please keep in mind that we currently do not support Windows and Linux.

  • Check if the problem is Proxy/VPN related.

  • Make sure you’re attempting to use Animator from a profile with Admin (not visitor) permissions in your Mac computer.

  • Check if someone else has been using your Animator account on a different computer. Our system doesn’t allow for password sharing. If a friend or colleague needs to use Animator, they will need to purchase a new seat to be able to use the app.


2. If you’re new to Animator and you’re not sure how to do something, please start by checking our learning resources. We have video tutorials, blog posts, help articles and docs. You can find a comprehensive list of resources here.

 3. If there’s something wrong, please go to https://help.haikuforteams.com/ and use the search bar at the top to see if there are any articles dedicated to the problem you’re experiencing. In most cases, there are. Please try typing different keywords and phrases related to your issue.

4. If nothing else worked, please contact us. You can email us at contact@haikuforteams.com or use the chat widget in our Help Center.

Information we need to help you

Please make sure to send all the information listed below when you contact us, so that we can address your problem faster. The more detail you include, the better we’ll be able to help you.

1. Include your Animator project link, which you can get from the Publish modal. 

2. Explain in as much detail as you can:

  • What you were trying to achieve

  • What you expected to happen

  • The steps you took right before the error occurred 

3. Make a screen recording of the problem, so that we can understand what you’re experiencing. You can use a tool like Loom, which allows you to record your screen and share a link; or Giphy Capture, and attach the recording to your message or email.

4. If this is not possible, the next best thing is for you to send us screenshots where the problem is clearly visible.

5. If the app crashed, please include the Reference error ID that shows up on your screen.

data.title: Small animation to video
data.description: I created a very small animation, which looks great on the share page but not when I export it to video. Why?
data.body:
The issue with your animation is that the Art-board and the animation itself are quite small. So, when you export as video, the video player enlarges it by default, causing it to look very pixelated. 

You can try two things:

  1. Try exporting in a different format, depending on what you need the animation for. E.g. if you need it for a mobile app, you can export a Lottie JSON, or if you need it for, say, a website, you can export for React, Vue, etc.

  2. If you really really want a video, in a quick and easy way, I’d suggest going to your animation's share page (you can get the link from the Publish modal), zooming in on the browser (it won’t pixelate), and use a tool like Giphy Capture to shoot a video of your screen. It will look as crisp as you need it!

data.title: External images not working
data.description: Some external images show up correctly on the project's share page, but not when I use the Lottie JSON file in my app
data.body:
This happens if your image is loading from your CDN rather than direct sources, in other words, if you directly imported an SVG, and the SVG had a remote CDN URL for the image contents. 

Lottie does not support images from the web and neither does our Lottie exporter. It only happens to show up on your project's Share page, because it works in the browser.

data.title: [Troubleshooting] Partially visible assets
data.description: When I transform a path into a larger shape, said shape is only partially visible. How can I fix it?
data.body: When something like this happens, you can try going to Code Mode, and setting "style.overflow": "visible" for your asset.

data.title: [Troubleshooting] Preview and exports are empty
data.description: I can play my animation on the timeline, but I can't see it on Preview mode or when I export it. Why?
data.body:
It is likely that you have your artboard (named "Main" on the properties panel) set at a 0px height and width. 

If you set a proper size (say 500 by 500 px) you can use preview mode and export correctly.

Please make sure to set the height and width of your artboard at frame 0.

data.title: 14-day trial start and duration
data.description: Is it 14 calendar days since download, since 1st run or 14 days that you actually use the app (spread over a longer period than 14 days)?
data.body: It should be 14 calendar days from your first sign-in to the desktop app.

data.title: [Troubleshooting] Origin animations not working on Lottie
data.description: Origin animations look fine on web, but they don't show for Lottie.
data.body: We currently don't support animating the origin property for Lottie. As of now, we use whatever origin is set at keyframe 0.

data.title: Lottie animation looks empty when implemented on iOS/Android
data.description: I have tried to implement the animation on iOS and Android native and there's just blank screen. What can I do to fix this?
data.body:
Please start by reading this article. If you are not using any of the features listed in that article, but are still having this issue, it's possible/likely that you're running into a versioning issue (also covered on the article).

As a sanity-check, you can try dropping one of your .json files here:  https://editor.lottiefiles.com/

If it renders (there, in lottie-web) then it's like an intra-Lottie consistency issue, which crops up every so often.  lottie-web, lottie-ios, and lottie-android all have slightly different API support — which varies, sometimes significantly, across versions of the library.

data.title: Using the Stroke dasharray/dashoffset on Illustrator paths
data.description: I'm not seeing values entered in the dasharray have any effect. Is this because it's an Illustrator-based path?
data.body:
It could be.  Illustrator has some quirks as it relates to exported SVG, and some of them are really difficult to track down.  Our Illustrator integration relies on Illustrator's built-in SVG exporter, so our control over these quirks is limited.

One other possibility is that there are (invisible) groups at play, and that you're trying to apply the dasharray/dashoffset property to the containing Group instead of the Path — you can try ungrouping your imported assets (cmd-shift-G inside Animator) to see if that fixes this issue.

data.title: Exporting assets from Sketch
data.description: Does it make a difference when marking objects for export through Sketch as SVG or PNG?
data.body:
It should not.  Any slice/artboard marked for export should be extracted as an SVG, which is the medium that Animator uses to render the assets. 

That said, if you want to rasterize assets in Sketch, you can -- use Sketch's Layer => Flatten Selection to Bitmap, and as long as the bitmap is marked for export, it will be treated as a bitmap in Animator.  This is useful esp. in cases where performance is bottlenecked on complex vector assets.

data.title: Animator + Unity
data.description: Is there a recommended path to getting Haiku Animator animations playing as Unity UI animations?
data.body:
We haven't thoroughly tested this, but best options seem to be:
a) render in a webview using something like this, or
b) participate or keep an eye on this conversation
